itemDescription: English woman, celebrated figure of an Irish legal case

wikipedia_page.main: Theresa Yelverton (née Maria Theresa Longworth;  c. 1827–33 – 13 September 1881) was an English writer who became notorious because of her involvement in the Yelverton case, a 19th-century Irish law case, which eventually resulted in a change to the law on mixed religion marriages in Ireland.
